posts.subject: 📚1.1 Accessing Article A: Your First Academic Reading Adventure
posts.message:
🕵️‍♀️ Academic Detective Challenge!

Hello everyone! 👋

Welcome to your first academic research task! Instead of giving you the direct link, let's practice the essential skill of finding academic articles - something you'll do constantly in university.

📖 Article A - Basic Information:

Title: Supporting schools to use face recognition systems: a continuance intention perspective of elementary school parents in China
Authors: Hong, J. C., Li, Y., & Kuo, S. Y.
Year: 2022
Journal: Education and Information Technologies
DOI: 10.1007/s10639-022-11084-7

🎯 Your Mission:

  1. Find the article online using the information above
  2. Access the full article (try multiple approaches if needed)
  3. Reply to this post with:
    • The direct link you found
    • What search strategy worked for you
    • What format options are available (PDF, HTML, etc.)
    • Any access challenges you encountered

💡 Search Strategies to Try:

  • 🔍 Google Scholar search with title/authors
  • 🏫 HKBU Library database
  • 🌐 DOI resolver (hint: try doi.org)
  • 📚 Direct publisher website search

📚 Why Locating and Managing Information Matters:

  • Builds Research Skills: Locating academic articles hones your ability to navigate scholarly resources, a critical skill for university success.
  • Supports Academic Success: Efficiently finding and organizing information ensures you can access key materials for assignments and exams.
  • Enhances Time Management: Using systems like Getting Things Done (GTD) helps you organize documents in a structured way, reducing stress and improving productivity.
  • Familiarizes with Library Systems: Mastering the HKBU Library database and other academic tools prepares you for independent research and lifelong learning.
  • Centralized Document Storage: Keep all your academic documents (e.g., PDFs, notes) in a dedicated folder or cloud system like Google Drive or OneDrive, as part of your GTD workflow, for easy access and reference.

🤝 Collaboration Encouraged!

If someone finds the link, others can still practice different search methods and share their experiences!

posts.subject: Re: 📚1.1 Accessing Article A: Your First Academic Reading Adventure
posts.message: I would also encourage students to look into Zotero or Mendeley - these are literature management tools that would be essential for dealing with large amount of literature.
